head.supplied: South-Yarra, 8/4/93. ¶ T. R. Wilson Esqr ¶ Under-Secretary ¶ Sir. ¶ ¶ I have the honor to report, that some few weeks ago a decade of lithograms, illustrative of Candolleaceous plants, ¶ was finishe...

div.p: To Thomas Wilson
V93/2957, unit 728, VPRS 3992/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.
The file contains a typed copy of this letter, made at the Chief Secretary's Department. South-Yarra, 8/4/93.
T. R. Wilson Esqr
Under-Secretary
Sir.

I have the honor to report, that some few weeks ago a decade of lithograms, illustrative of Candolleaceous plants,
B93.02.04. was finished in the Government's Printing Office, when a copy was submitted to the hon. the Chief Secretary and one to yourself.
M to T. Wilson, 25 February 1893. I beg now to submit for the consideration of the hon. the Premier a list of Recipients of this inexpensive small publication, now discontinued.

The list comprises only such Institutions or men of Science, with whom the Gov. Botanist's Establishment stands in direct litterary intercourse, and from whom therefore publications are received in return for such sendings as the one now recommended.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I have the honor to be,

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: Sir, your obed. servant

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: Ferd von Mueller,

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: Govt. Botanist

Institutions proposed to receive the Decade of Candolleaceous Plants as standing in literary interchange with the Govt. Botanist's establishment
List written by Georg Luehmann and signed and dated by M.
